com.invectorate.open.queutures

Interface QueutureBox<V>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - 

    public interface QueutureBox<V>
    The opaque interface that Informables that are expected to be used to generate data for Queutures use to submit new information. When an object is put(Object) into a QueutureBox, it eventually becomes available to consumers of a Queuture via Queuture.next(). This object is typically backed by some sort of BlockingQueue.
    Author:
    Noah

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void put(V object)
      Add a new object into this box.
      void put(V object, long timeout, TimeUnit unit)
      Add a new object into this box, failing if it takes longer than the specified timeout.

    • Method Detail

      • put

        void put(V object)
         throws InterruptedException
        Add a new object into this box. Requests to add objects into the box may block indefinitely depending on the queuing semantics of the underlying Queuture.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to store.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given object is null.
        InterruptedException - If the current thread is interrupted while attempting to store data.

      • put

        void put(V object,
       long timeout,
       TimeUnit unit)
         throws TimeoutException,
                InterruptedException
        Add a new object into this box, failing if it takes longer than the specified timeout. Requests to add objects into the box may block for time periods up to the timeout specified depending on the queuing semantics of the underlying Queuture.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to store.
        timeout - The maximum time to wait.
        unit - The time unit of the timeout parameter.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the given object is null.
        TimeoutException - If the data could not be stored within the constraints of the given timeout.
        InterruptedException - If the current thread is interrupted while attempting to store data.
